@graph.rdfs:comment: The set of IUDX resource APIs supported by a given ResourceGroup. ENUM: [TEMPORAL, SPATIAL, ATTR, TEXT]
@graph.rdfs:label: iudxResourceAPIs

@graph.rdfs:comment: Sample file download link for the resource
@graph.rdfs:label: dataSampleFile

@graph.rdfs:comment: Type of resource. ENUM: [MESSAGESTREAM, DATASET, FILE, GSLAYER, MEDIASTREAM].
@graph.rdfs:label: resourceType

@graph.rdfs:comment: URI pointing to the data-descriptor entity
@graph.rdfs:label: dataDescriptor

@graph.rdfs:comment: IRI pointing to the provider entity associated with the given catalogue item
@graph.rdfs:label: provider

@graph.rdfs:comment: IRI pointing to the resourceGroup entity associated with the resource.
@graph.rdfs:label: resourceGroup

@graph.rdfs:comment: Defines the access policy for resources belonging to ResourceGroup or an individual Resource. In case of ResourceGroup item, it can take values: [OPEN, SECURE, MIXED]. OPEN implies all Resources in the group are open (and need no authorization token for data access). SECURE implies that all Resources are secured and will need authorization token for access. MIXED implies that some of Resource items may be open. In case of accessPolicy being set to MIXED in the resource group, the individual resource items will further qualify the access policy using this field. In case of Resource item, it will take values from: [OPEN, SECURE].
@graph.rdfs:label: accessPolicy

@graph.rdfs:comment: Comma separated discovery tags associated with an IUDXEntity (resource , resource Group)
@graph.rdfs:label: tags

@graph.rdfs:comment: Information about the Authorization Server used for a given resource.
@graph.rdfs:label: authServerInfo

@graph.rdfs:comment: IRI pointing to the ResourceServer entity for a given Resource or ResourceGroup.
@graph.rdfs:label: resourceServer

@graph.rdfs:comment: Stringified sample object of the resource
@graph.rdfs:label: dataSample

@graph.rdfs:comment: Location associated with a resource Item (a spatial point), a group of resource items (a spatial region) or even an observation in case of a mobile sensor.
@graph.rdfs:label: location

@graph.rdfs:comment: Class of all IUDX Entities (Resource, ResourceGroup, ResourceServer, Provider etc.)
@graph.rdfs:label: IUDXEntity

@graph.rdfs:comment: ID of the entity.
@graph.rdfs:label: id

@graph.rdfs:comment: ID of the associated entity.
@graph.rdfs:label: relatedEntity

@graph.rdfs:comment: Name of the entity.
@graph.rdfs:label: name

@graph.rdfs:comment: DateTime of deprecation of a catalogue item.
@graph.rdfs:label: itemDeprecatedAt

@graph.rdfs:comment: DateTime of modification of a catalogue item.
@graph.rdfs:label: itemModifiedAt

@graph.rdfs:comment: DateTime of creation of a catalogue item.
@graph.rdfs:label: itemCreatedAt

@graph.rdfs:comment: Human readable label for an entity
@graph.rdfs:label: label

@graph.rdfs:comment: Status of a catalouge item. ENUM: [ACTIVE, DEPRECATED].
@graph.rdfs:label: itemStatus

@graph.rdfs:comment: Most generic IUDX object.
@graph.rdfs:label: Thing

@graph.rdfs:comment: Description for an IUDX thing.
@graph.rdfs:label: description
